t: Matthew 11
Messengers from John the Baptist
When*p Jesus had finished instructing his twelve disciples, he went on from there to teach and preach in their cities.
Now*p when John heard in prison about the deeds of the Christ, he sent word by his disciples
and said to him, “Are you the one who is to come, or shall we look for another?”
And Jesus answered them, “Go*r and*r tell*r John*r what*r you*r hear*r and*r see:*r

the*r blind*r receive*r their*r sight*r and*r the*r lame*r walk,*r lepers*r are*r cleansed*r and*r the*r deaf*r hear,*r and*r the*r dead*r are*r raised*r up,*r and*r the*r poor*r have*r good*r news*r preached*r to*r them.*r
And*r blessed*r is*r the*r one*r who*r is*r not*r offended*r by*r me.”*r
As*p they went away, Jesus began to speak to the crowds concerning John: “What*r did*r you*r go*r out*r into*r the*r wilderness*r to*r see?*r A*r reed*r shaken*r by*r the*r wind?*r
What*r then*r did*r you*r go*r out*r to*r see?*r A*r man*r dressed*r in*r soft*r clothing?*r Behold,*r those*r who*r wear*r soft*r clothing*r are*r in*r kings’*r houses.*r
What*r then*r did*r you*r go*r out*r to*r see?*r A*r prophet?*r Yes,*r I*r tell*r you,*r and*r more*r than*r a*r prophet.*r
This*r is*r he*r of*r whom*r it*r is*r written,*r “‘Behold,*rpn I*r send*r my*r messenger*r before*r your*r face,*r who*rld will*r prepare*r your*r way*r before*r you.’*r

Truly,*rp I*r say*r to*r you,*r among*r those*r born*r of*r women*r there*r has*r arisen*r no*r one*r greater*r than*r John*r the*r Baptist.*r Yet*r the*r one*r who*r is*r least*r in*r the*r kingdom*r of*r heaven*r is*r greater*r than*r he.*r
From*r the*r days*r of*r John*r the*r Baptist*r until*r now*r the*r kingdom*r of*r heaven*r has*r suffered*r violence,*r and*r the*r violent*r take*r it*r by*r force.*r
For*r all*r the*r Prophets*r and*r the*r Law*r prophesied*r until*r John,*r
and*r if*r you*r are*r willing*r to*r accept*r it,*r he*r is*r Elijah*r who*r is*r to*r come.*r
He*r who*r has*r ears*r to*r hear,*r let*r him*r hear.*r
“But*rp to*r what*r shall*r I*r compare*r this*r generation?*r It*r is*r like*r children*r sitting*r in*r the*r marketplaces*r and*r calling*r to*r their*r playmates,*r
“‘We*rpn played*r the*r flute*r for*r you,*r and*r you*r did*r not*r dance;*r we*rld sang*r a*r dirge,*r and*r you*r did*r not*r mourn.’*r
For*rp John*r came*r neither*r eating*r nor*r drinking,*r and*r they*r say,*r ‘He*r has*r a*r demon.’*r

The*r Son*r of*r Man*r came*r eating*r and*r drinking,*r and*r they*r say,*r ‘Look*r at*r him!*r A*r glutton*r and*r a*r drunkard,*r a*r friend*r of*r tax*r collectors*r and*r sinners!’*r Yet*r wisdom*r is*r justified*r by*r her*r deeds.”*r
Woe to Unrepentant Cities
Then*p he began to denounce the cities where most of his mighty works had been done, because they did not repent.

“Woe*r to*r you,*r Chorazin!*r Woe*r to*r you,*r Bethsaida!*r For*r if*r the*r mighty*r works*r done*r in*r you*r had*r been*r done*r in*r Tyre*r and*r Sidon,*r they*r would*r have*r repented*r long*r ago*r in*r sackcloth*r and*r ashes.*r
But*r I*r tell*r you,*r it*r will*r be*r more*r bearable*r on*r the*r day*r of*r judgment*r for*r Tyre*r and*r Sidon*r than*r for*r you.*r

And*r you,*r Capernaum,*r will*r you*r be*r exalted*r to*r heaven?*r You*r will*r be*r brought*r down*r to*r Hades.*r For*r if*r the*r mighty*r works*r done*r in*r you*r had*r been*r done*r in*r Sodom,*r it*r would*r have*r remained*r until*r this*r day.*r
But*r I*r tell*r you*r that*r it*r will*r be*r more*r tolerable*r on*r the*r day*r of*r judgment*r for*r the*r land*r of*r Sodom*r than*r for*r you.”*r
Come to Me, and I Will Give You Rest

At*p that time Jesus declared, “I*r thank*r you,*r Father,*r Lord*r of*r heaven*r and*r earth,*r that*r you*r have*r hidden*r these*r things*r from*r the*r wise*r and*r understanding*r and*r revealed*r them*r to*r little*r children;*r
yes,*r Father,*r for*r such*r was*r your*r gracious*r will.*r

All*r things*r have*r been*r handed*r over*r to*r me*r by*r my*r Father,*r and*r no*r one*r knows*r the*r Son*r except*r the*r Father,*r and*r no*r one*r knows*r the*r Father*r except*r the*r Son*r and*r anyone*r to*r whom*r the*r Son*r chooses*r to*r reveal*r him.*r
Come*r to*r me,*r all*r who*r labor*r and*r are*r heavy*r laden,*r and*r I*r will*r give*r you*r rest.*r
Take*r my*r yoke*r upon*r you,*r and*r learn*r from*r me,*r for*r I*r am*r gentle*r and*r lowly*r in*r heart,*r and*r you*r will*r find*r rest*r for*r your*r souls.*r
For*r my*r yoke*r is*r easy,*r and*r my*r burden*r is*r light.”*r
